svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
March 2, 2020" date: "2020-03-03"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
* Notes from the latest stateless ethereum call . Witness format and the data retrieval
problem
* Latest Nethermind fixes some peering issues
Eth2
* the Eth2 explainer to read first
* Latest Eth2 call . Notes from Mamy and Ben
* Getting to Eth1 finality with Eth2
* Nimbus client update. discv5, BLS sigs, lightweight stack traces
* The train-and-hotel EE
* Rewards and penalties in eth2
Layer2
* Loopring launches zk-rollup exchange doing 100 tx per second (with 2000 possible as
the relayer gets optimized). Due to snark prover optimizations , it costs just 0.01
cents (ie, $0.000124) per trade
* Run Fuel optimistic rollup in NodeJS in a few minutes
* PlasmaLeap is switching to rollups
Stuff for developers
* Making Solidity stack traces and console.log more useful with a JSON-RPC interface to
connect to Buidler EVM from wallets and front ends
* A linked list implementation in Solidity
* Sokt : a library for managing multiple Solidity versions for Java or Kotlin
* Writing upgradeable contracts in OpenZeppelin tutorial
* Dapp starter kit using Buidler + Waffle + TypeChain + Vue (TypeScript)
* tx2uml generates a UML sequence diagram of all the contract calls, even in big txs
* Gas stipends, the 1/64 rule, contract calls, and the insufficient gas griefing attack
* Solfuzz : assertion checker for Solidity contracts using gray box fuzzing
* gnark : fast groth16 snark verification library in Go
Ecosystem
* ETHLondon winners . All ETHLondon submissions .
* All the EthDenver submissions
* Taylor Monahan’s DeFi and Risk essay
* Flash attacks will be the new normal
* Check by address all of your token approvals
Enterprise
* Hyperledger Besu v1.4 - better tx signing, better APIs, better sync
Governance, DAOs, and standards
* ERC2537 : BLS12-381 curve operations
* ERC2539 : BLS12-377 curve operations
* ERC2542 add TXGASLIMIT, CALLGASLIMIT, TXGASREFUND opcodes
* ERC2541 : EY SW6-Bis curve operations
* ERC2535 : Diamond standard for upgradeable contracts
* ERC2547 : composable multiclass token
* EIP2544 : ENS Wildcard resolution
* EIP2538 : Anti-ProgPoW statement from community members
* It seems that when the DAG hits 4GB that a decent amount of hashpower will be knocked
offline , both ASIC and GPU
* Compound announces a governance token (with delegated voting!) to control all parts
of the protocol. I bet this will be widely emulated.
Application layer
* A postmortem on the iearn.finance trades that had tongues wagging this week
* Zora : a marketplace for Unisocks-style sales, from Saint Frame
* Nori : a marketplace for carbon removal, and how it fixes the problems with carbon
offsets
* If you didn’t play Ethernal’s multi-user dungeon alpha release, here’s how it went
* Melon Terminal v2 , a new frontend for Melon to go with Melon v1.1 adding assets and
Uniswap/0x v3
* Creepts , a tower defense tournament on Rinkeby testnet
* Due to sponsors, PoolTogether is higher EV than just holding cDai/cUSDC. Much higher
variance of course.
* PoolTogether tickets are now tokenized, here’s how to get a free one
Tokens/Business/Regulation
* What the Internet did to data, Ethereum will do to finance
* SEC charges Steven Seagal with touting unregistered securities offering
* A winery is selling tokenized wine on OpenSea . It’s live now . If you want to
support this newsletter, here’s a referral link to buy fancy French wine .
General
* Geokeys : key recovery system through location and password
* It appears that Huobi/Binance powered up their customers’ STEEM in order to
participate in a TRON attack on the Steem chain. DPOS in action.
* ApexE3 launches a beta of advanced tools for retail crypto traders
* MACI anonymization using rerandomizable encryption
* A sketch for a STARK-based VM
* STARK for Schnorr sigs verification
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new in bold ) :
* Mar 3-5 - EthCC (Paris)
* Mar 14 - Augur v1 cutoff
* Mar 29-Apr4 - EthLagos
* Apr 3-6 - NonCon (Vienna)
* Apr 13 - Deadline to apply for 50k euro for blockchain startup s in Europe
* Apr 24-26 - EthTurin
* Apr 29-30 - SoliditySummit (Berlin)
* May 7 - SmartCon0 (NYC)
* May 8-9 - Ethereal Summit (NYC)
* May 15-17 - ETHNYC
* May 15 - EthBarcelona R&D workshop
Thank you, ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys .
I own 100% Week In Ethereum News. Editorial control has always been me.
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum News ,” then
here’s a hint: don’t email me. Do put it on Reddit.
I really want you to link to weekinethereumnews.com
Issue permalink: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-march-2-2020/
Follow me on Twitter , because most of what is linked here gets tweeted first:
@evan_van_ness
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive the weekly
Week in Ethereum News
